class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.obejcts.TTS
class.comment: Synthesizes text to speech and plays it. After initializing the object you should wait for the Ready event. See this <link>example|http://www.basic4ppc.com/forum/basic4android-getting-started-tutorials/7043-android-text-speech-example.html</link>.

method.name: Release
method.comment: Releases any resources related to this object. You will need to initialize the object again before use. Note that it is safe to call this method with an uninitialized object.

method.name: Speak
method.comment: Speaks the given text. ClearQueue - If True then all waiting texts are dismissed and the new text is spoken. Otherwise the new text is added to the queue.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the object. The Ready event will be raised when the text to speech engine is ready. EventName - The Sub that will handle the Ready event.

method.name: SetLanguage
method.comment: Sets the spoken language. Language - Language code. Two lowercase letters. Country - Country code. Two uppercase letters. Pass an empty string if not needed. Returns True if a matching language is available. The country value will be ignored if the language code matches and the country code does not match.

method.name: Stop
method.comment: Stops speaking any currently playing text (and dismisses texts in the queue).

property.name: SpeechRate
property.comment: Sets the speech rate. Default is 1. Example: TTS1.SpeechRate = 0.5

property.name: Pitch
property.comment: Sets the pitch value. Default is 1. Example: TTS1.Pitch = 1.5
